qas.question: What does Catalan have in common with other Romance languages in the same area?
What other Iberian Romance languages are found in this area?
Besides vocabulary and grammar, what other diffinence is there from other similar area languages?
What are these similar Latin derived languages called?

context: Catalan shares <a0_0>many traits<a0_0/> with its neighboring Romance languages. However, despite being mostly situated in the <a1_0>Iberian Peninsula<a1_0/>, Catalan differs more from Iberian Romance (such as <a2_0>Spanish and Portuguese<a2_0/>) in terms of vocabulary, <a3_0>pronunciation<a3_0/>, and grammar than from <a4_0>Gallo-Romance<a4_0/> (Occitan, French, Gallo-Italic languages, etc.). These similarities are most notable with Occitan.
